etymologies: Middle English: from Old French quaille, from medieval Latin coacula (probably imitative of its call)

definitions: a small short-tailed Old World game bird resembling a tiny partridge, typically having brown camouflaged plumage.

notes.text: Family Phasianidae: three genera, in particular Coturnix, and several species, e.g. the widespread migratory common quail (C. coturnix)

shortDefinitions: small short-tailed Old World game bird resembling tiny partridge

definitions: a small or medium-sized New World game bird, the male of which has distinctive facial markings.

notes.text: Family Phasianidae (or Odontophoridae): several genera and many species, including the bobwhite

shortDefinitions: small or medium-sized New World game bird

etymologies: late Middle English (in the sense ‘waste away, come to nothing’): of unknown origin

definitions: feel or show fear or apprehension

examples.text: she quailed at his heartless words

shortDefinitions: feel or show fear or apprehension
